content.description: Members of one population of the striped stem borer insect engage in mating behavior in the early hours of the night, whereas members of a second population mate much later during the night. Crossbreeding between individuals from the two populations produces offspring that mate at an intermediate time.
content.question: Which of the following is the most likely cause of the different timing of mating behavior between the two populations?

choices.label: The seasonal difference in day length
The difference in learned behavior between the populations

skill.text: 6.E: Predict the causes or effects of a change in, or disruption to, one or more components in a biological system.
